004package kut;
005
006import java.util.function.Function;
007import java.util.ArrayList;
008
009/** Wrapper of one element */
010public class Wrap<T> {
011  /** Elemento. */
012  public T e;
013
014  /**
015   * Constructor.
016   * @param e Elemento.
017   */
018  public Wrap (T e) {
019    this.e = e;
020  }
021
022  @Override
023  public String toString () {
024    return "Wrapper(" + e.toString() + ")";
025  }
026
027  /**
028   * Returns Wrapper 'JSONized' in 'js'.
029   * @param <T> Type of Wrapper element.
030   * @param js Wrapper 'JSONized'.
031   * @param eFromJs Function to restore the element of the Wrapper 'JSONized' in 'js'.
032   * @return The Wrapper 'JSONized" in 'js'.
033   */
034  public static <T> Wrap<T> fromJs (String js, Function<String, T> eFromJs) {
035    ArrayList<String> a = Js.ra(js);
036    if (a.size() != 1) {
037      js = js.length() <= 50 ? js : js.substring(47) + "...";
038      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
039      "  \n'" + js + "' is not a valid Wrapper JSONization." +
040      "  \n Wrapper JSONization type is \"[JS-element]\""
041      );
042    }
043    return new Wrap<>(eFromJs.apply(a.get(0)));
044  }
045
046  /**
047   * Returns JSON representation of 'w' ("[JS-element]").
048   * @param <T> Type of 'w' element.
049   * @param w Wrapper.
050   * @param eToJs Function to 'JSONize' the element of 'w'.
051   * @return JSON representation of 'w'.
052   */
053  public static <T> String toJs (Wrap<T> w, Function<T, String> eToJs) {
054    return Js.w(Arr.mk(eToJs.apply(w.e)));
055  }
056
057}
